episodes.title: UFO Cult Cookbook : Heaven's Gate Diet
episodes.description:
Did you know the Heaven’s Gate cult had their own cookbook? Lace up those Nikes and grab the garlic, we’re hitching a ride on the comet to flavor town.

Major sources for this video include "Transfiguration Diet" by the Littlegreen Thinktank Inc and "Heaven's Gate: America's UFO Religion" by Benjamin Zeller.

If you enjoy exploring unusual history or cult stories, hit subscribe and leave a comment on what strange fact (or food) surprised you the most.

DISCLAIMER: This video is intended for educational purposes only. It explores historical events and beliefs associated with the Heaven’s Gate movement and its dietary practices. The content is not meant to promote or endorse any harmful behaviors, ideologies, or practices. If you or someone you know is struggling with thoughts of self-harm, please seek professional help or contact a crisis support organization immediately. Viewer discretion is advised.

Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act of 1976, allowance is made for “fair use” for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational, or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use.

episodes.title: Murder of Joseph Smith : a Mormon Mystery
episodes.description:
The founder of Mormonism was murdered. Who killed Joseph Smith? Why?

Major sources for this video include Joseph Smith: Rough Stone Rolling by Richard Bushman and History of the Church by Joseph Smith Jr.

Information from the Doctrine and Covenants is taken from the official website of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Other primary source material is taken from the Joseph Smith Papers Project.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Cult of the Blind Pope : the Palmarian Church
episodes.description:
The secret world of the Palmarian Church, the Spanish cult with their own pope.

Major sources for this video include “A Pope of their Own: El Palmar de Troya and the Palmarian Church” by Magnus Lundberg and the podcast “The Palmarian Church: A Criticism.”

Information from the Palmarian Catechism, Creed, Norms of Christian Decency, and Prayer Book are all taken from the official website of the Palmarian Church.
